summary: This document is a probable cause affidavit detailing the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's unlawful sexual activities with minors. It includes sworn statements from multiple victims and witnesses, describing the nature of the massages provided to Epstein and the sexual acts that occurred during these sessions. The affidavit outlines the methods used to recruit young girls for these massages and the payments made to them. This document is a communication from the Western Union Custodian of Records acknowledging the receipt of a subpoena for money transfer records related to the Epstein case. It includes a reference number for the subpoena and offers assistance if needed.

connections.description: MS describes being a victim of Epstein's sexual advances during massages.
Tony is identified as Epstein's assistant, facilitating the recruitment of young girls for massages.
Jose Alessi worked for Epstein and provided insights into the operations at Epstein's residence.
Alfredo Rodriguez was employed by Epstein and described the nature of the massages and the young age of the girls involved.

events.title: Initial Report of Sexual Activity
events.description: A report was made regarding unlawful sexual activity involving a fourteen-year-old female at Epstein's residence.

events.title: Police Investigation
events.description: Police conducted an investigation into Epstein's activities, interviewing multiple victims and witnesses.

events.title: Interview of Victim
events.description: A victim provided a sworn statement detailing her experiences with Epstein, including sexual advances during massages.

locations: 20 Corporate Hills Drive, St. Charles, MO 63301
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is accused of engaging in unlawful sexual activities with minors, specifically through massages.
Multiple victims reported being recruited to provide massages for Epstein, often under the pretense of making money.
Victims described instances of sexual abuse during the massages, including the use of vibrators and other sexual acts.
The investigation revealed that Epstein's assistants played a role in facilitating the recruitment of young girls.
Evidence collected during the investigation included witness statements, phone records, and physical evidence from Epstein's residence.
The Western Union Custodian of Records received a subpoena regarding money transfer records.
A Western Union Subpoena File Number has been assigned for reference.
The document is marked as confidential.
